oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mayor Ben West with Japanese representatives at Genesco, 1961 March 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured left to right: Stephan Klausner, president of Genesco’s Intercontinental Shoe Company; Nashville Mayor Ben West; Toshinoshin Sakurai; Yanosuke Yoshioka; Kyo Kaneko, and Yasuma Oda. At the opening ceremony the visitors presented special colorful carp fish flags on the first day of their 10 days tour and inspection of the enterprise. The Tokyo businessmen were awarded gold keys and honorary citizenship of Nashville by Mayor Ben West. Genesco was originally founded as the Jarman Shoe Company in 1924 as a footwear manufacturer, they were later renamed the General Shoe Company in the 1930s. The company took its current name, Genesco, in 1959. Under the leadership of W. Maxey Jarman, the son of co-founder J.F. Jarman, the company began the process of diversifying and expanding the business into an international apparel conglomerate. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: West, Ben, 1911-1974; Klausner, Stephen
